content:
If you are a beginner birdwatcher, I would recommend visiting some of the easier spots for birdwatching in Costa Rica that still offer a variety of species to see. Some good options include:

1. La Paz Waterfall Gardens: This wildlife sanctuary offers easy hiking trails through beautiful gardens and waterfalls, with opportunities to see hummingbirds, toucans, tanagers, and more.

2. Manuel Antonio National Park: This park is known for its beautiful beaches and is an excellent location for spotting a variety of tropical birds, including toucans, parrots, and macaws.

3. Palo Verde National Park: Located in the Northwestern province of Costa Rica, this park is a wetland oasis with a boat tour where you will have many opportunities to see waterbirds and shorebirds.

4. Savegre Valley: The Savegre Valley is a high-altitude region with a range of lodges that cater to birdwatchers, including easy-access birdfeeders that attract an array of hummingbirds, including the resplendent Quetzal, Silver-Throated Tanager and many others.

5. Carara National Park, near Jaco Beach: The park provides an easy hiking trail and the chance to see so many different species like scarlet macaws, toucans, and many others.

These spots offer relatively easy birding opportunities with a large variety of species to see, making them ideal for beginners. Of course, you can always book a guide who will help you find and identify the birds, making the experience even more rewarding.
